result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy M Marking was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Prostitution-Nonmarital Sex. Intercourse, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.30(1).
  • Prostitution-Nonmarital Sex. Intercourse, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $200 DNA surcharge remitted. $243  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.

Sex offender registry required during the length of probation. Sex Offender treatment as recommended by PO Agent. State offers these exceptions: immediate family members permitted to stay overnight at def's residence. bow hunting permitted at the agent's discretion and no computer access for illegal purposes but agent can search the computer at any time. No computer access for illegal purposes includes: any appliance used to search the internet. I.E. smartphone, IPhones, laptops, tablets.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
$243  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
All other conditions are the same as count 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy M Marking

Defendant in court with Attorney Charles W. Giesen.  Paul W. Humphrey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on April 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not have any unsupervised contact, direct or indirect, with minors except for incidental contact in public,
- Defendant shall not access any computer or access the internet except for work purposes, seeking employment, and for communication with his attorney, Charles Giesen.
  - Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to release.
  Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 12.  Status conference scheduled for 04-07-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Charles W. Giesen in court on behalf of defendant.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.
